title: Becassine
author: Becassine
content: I haven't seen anything elsewhere on the forum about the phenomenal Bybit hack that has just taken place. The hackers are said to be from the Lazarus group, and they are allegedly reselling the fruit of the thefts. Evidently a massive withdrawal of cryptos is taking place right now, while Bybit's funds would be sufficient to cover the losses. You can follow this infernal saga on X.

comments.author: headingnorth
comments.body: Ethereum getting hacked again for the ten thousandth time is a very normal thing for shitcoins. And yet there are still plenty of idiots buying it up. Altcoins are a security nightmare and are the hackers paradise, but they will never run out of victims.

comments.author: KiaKia
comments.body: I want to share my thoughts for those who may not be aware.I believe the biggest mistake made by the founder of Ethereum was transitioning from proof of work (PoW) to proof of stake (PoS). In my opinion, this decision has been detrimental to the cryptocurrency space.If Ethereum had remained a PoW system, I think the price wouldn't be as stagnant as it is now. Additionally, the blockchain would be even more secure than it currently is.It's disheartening to see that, after Satoshi Nakamoto set a solid example for future founders, many have chosen to pursue different paths in order to stand out. However, nothing surpasses the principles of proof of work and decentralization.Without these two elements, I believe a project lacks value.

comments.author: jstyler
comments.body: i actually think the bybit hack is a symptom of a larger issue, proof of stake's lack of decentralization and vulnerability to 51% attacks is a major problem, we need to learn from our mistakes and stick to the tried and true PoW consensus algorithm

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: These hackers just need a small loop hole and they will penetrate into what seem to have tight security. I don't expect that it would be possible to hack a strong exchange like bybit, at least with the evident of what has happened to other exchange that failed due to hack incident, bybit should be smart enough to take every precautions that would have prevented this from happening.

comments.author: Davidvictorson
comments.body: Today it's the Lazarus group, tomorrow it is another hacking group. Discussing this with anyone, I'd say it is not about the group because there will always be these hackers and scammers. The focus should be on yourself and what you do with the cyber security information you know and how you protect yourself. This is not the first time we have heard it said that not your keys, not your coins or don't save your crypto in a CEX. Focus on yourself and your security online.
